actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Education and Labor.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Education and Labor
actions.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Labor Standards.

official_title: A bill to amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to provide an increase in the minimum wage under that Act and to adjust that wage to equal one half the average private hourly wage and to establish a lower wage for employees under age 22.

summary.text: Fair Labor Standards Amendments of 1987 - Amends the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to increase the minimum wage. Provides for adjustments to the minimum wage until it reaches one-half of the average private hourly wage. Provides for a lower minimum wage for: (1) part-time employment of individuals under age 19; and (2) full-time students between the ages of 19 and 22.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to provide an increase in the minimum wage under that Act and to adjust that wage to equal one half the average private hourly wage and to establish a lower wage for employees under age 22.
